title: Hugh E. Jones
text:
I am passionate about using my data and analytical science skills to process and analyse large datasets.
I successfully defended my PhD thesis in December last year (2022) and I am now working for a Fintech start-up
The focus of my PhD research was the study of base oils and other complex mixtures by Fourier transform ion cyclotron resonance (FTICR) mass spectrometry (MS).
In addition to my research, I developed both new R routines and applications (see some here), to support both my own and colleagues research activities, as well as the maintenance and continual development of critical software tools used by the wider research group.

title: Hugh E. Jones
text:
Education
September 2018 - 2022 | PhD in Analytical Science | University of Warwick
September 2014 - June 2018 | Master of Chemistry (MChem) 2:1 | University of Warwick

title: Projects
text: Here are some of the projects I have worked on during my PhD and spare time

title: Projects
text:
Shiny applications

Calibration Helper - An application to construct calibration lists for use with mass spectrometry data. Live version here
Method Digester - An application to read Bruker .method (XML) files for FTICR mass spectrometers. Live version here
Kendrick Mass Defect Tool - An application to plot a Kendrick mass defect (KMD) plot. Live version here
VKSim - An application to simulate various reactions on a van Krevelen diagram. Live version here
InterLabStudy - Tool to compare DOM data from various laboratories to a standard molecular assignment. More details can be found on the InterLabStudy GitHub page
